meanings.definition: An inscription on a building, statue, or coin.
meanings.sent1: The ancient temple had epigraphs carved into its walls.
meanings.sent2: The epigraphs on the old coin revealed its age and origin.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child tried to write his name as an epigraph on the school wall.
meanings.sent4: The epigraphs of history are like whispers from the past, telling tales of forgotten times.
meanings.sent5: The intricate epigraphs on the statue were a testament to the craftsmanship of the sculptor.

meanings.definition: A quotation or saying at the beginning of a book or chapter.
meanings.sent1: The author chose a meaningful epigraph for the opening of her novel.
meanings.sent2: The epigraphs in the textbook provided context for the upcoming chapter.
meanings.sent3: The humorous epigraph made the readers chuckle before diving into the story.
meanings.sent4: The epigraphs acted as guiding stars, leading readers into the world of the book.
meanings.sent5: The poignant epigraph left a lasting impression on those who read it.
